file_content.text: [Whatever this pile of rubble once was, it has crumbled beyond recognition.]
[Gaden Ko approaches, now that you have made the path safe]
Here. The heart of Lishi-Na's marker.
I'm sorry, Gaden-Ko. Perhaps it can be repaired.
But it's broken.
A step on your journey is complete.
A good beginning, then.
I imagine one heap of stonework looks much the same as another.
Are you sure?
Outsider misunderstanding. A foundation stone. The entire building is the marker.
Ruins were built by Lishi-Na and... family. A symbol. Mystics are supported by all.
Something is improper.
Aggghhh!
Idiot boy! A perfect strike, ruined by an centimeter. No matter. That scratch will finish you soon enough.
Get away from Gaden-Ko or you'll answer to me.
Leave him alone.
Who are you?
Address me as Lord Shendan. And I know who you are.
For this, you'll never lift a lightsaber again, Sith.
I'll see you die first.
Predictable arrogance.
There were whispers in Voss-Ka, of a Jedi stupid enough to escort a young Mystic away from the city.
But when they hear the brat died in your care, the Voss will see the Republic very differently.
You will not force the Voss to follow your path.
I won't allow that.
It's already too late.
Don't move. I'll be with you in a moment.
Stay calm, Gaden-Ko.
Gaden-Ko's still alive. He can tell his people all about your little scheme.
You haven't won yet.
The boy's as good as dead.
The toxin on that blade was an exotic Republic compound, as any investigation will show. Even a drop is eventually fatal.
The destiny of the Voss is to join the Empire, and it is you who have made this possible. Think about that, as you die.
